finding: The variant rs112735431 is known to cause a nonsynonymous substitution in the RNF213 gene, which has been established as a susceptibility variant for moyamoya disease. It showed a relatively strong association with CAD development (OR_CAD = 1.61) and is specific to the East Asian population, which explains its significance in CAD that previous studies in Europeans could not assess.
title: Population-specific and transethnic genome-wide analyses reveal distinct and shared genetic risks of coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs112401631 was identified as a fine-mapped variant for asthma, with a posterior inclusion probability (PIP) of 0.27. It was linked to the gene CCR7 in various T cell subtypes, including CD8 effector, CD4 memory, CD8 naive, and CD4 naive. The CCR7 gene is known for its role in the homing of T cell populations to lymphoid organs, and CCR7+ memory CD4+ T cells have previously been associated with the severity of asthma.
title: Single-cell multiome regression models identify functional and disease-associated enhancers and enable chromatin potential analysis

finding: The variant rs2941506 was found to significantly decrease GATA4-DNA binding affinity leading to a 1.3-fold reduction in luciferase activity. This decrease was associated with lower expression levels of multiple genes, contributing to a greater understanding of its involvement in cardiovascular dysfunction.
title: Cardiovascular Disease-Associated Non-Coding Variants Disrupt GATA4-DNA Binding and Regulatory Functions

finding: The SNP rs9896202 was part of a credible set of variants fine-mapped to a <italic>cis</italic>-eQTL signal for the gene <italic>CBX8</italic>, specifically overlapping transcription factor binding sites and disrupting the binding motif of <italic>EGR1</italic>. This association provided insights into the regulation of gene expression through transcription factors.
title: The GTEx Consortium atlas of genetic regulatory effects across human tissues

finding: The SNP rs1493550 was identified as being associated with the expression of the SLC39A11 gene, which is a member of the solute carrier family and located on chromosome 17. This connection was made clear after the application of the KiMONo method, which resolved the relationship between this SNP and the methylation site cg26124719, both situated in an intron. The findings indicated that KiMONo effectively identified expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) and expression quantitative trait methylation (eQTM) involving SLC39A11, suggesting its utility in discovering complex gene regulatory relationships.
title: Knowledge guided multi-level network inference

finding: The SNP rs8080074 was associated with Wnt-related signaling pathways, which were crucial for proper organ development and functionality in stem cells. Specifically, this variant was linked to findings that emphasized its role in colorectal cancers, as discussed in the work by Ravindranath and Cadigan. In the broad context of morphogen-mediated signaling, rs8080074 influenced the differentiation process in various cell types, highlighting its significance in both developmental biology and cancer research.
title: Canonical Wnt signaling promotes formation of somatic permeability barrier for proper germ cell differentiation

finding: This SNP was linked to increased risk for colorectal cancer and influences body measurements and blood cell traits.
title: Long-range regulatory effects of Neandertal DNA in modern humans

finding: Also belonged to a locus with detected positive selection, revealing Neandertal influence through associated phenotypic traits.
title: Long-range regulatory effects of Neandertal DNA in modern humans

finding: The SNP rs3138036 was identified as a significant <italic>cis</italic> pQTL related to the protein MCP2, explaining up to 35.80% of inter-individual variation in protein levels. This relationship was consistent across different statistical methods, including Bayesian and ordinary least squares analyses.
title: Integrative omics approach to identify the molecular architecture of inflammatory protein levels in healthy older adults

finding: The lead eQTL for ORMDL3, driven by rs4065275, was significantly associated with rheumatoid arthritis and displayed state-dependent effects, showing the strongest eQTL in GZMB+ cytotoxic CD8+ T cells.
title: Modeling memory T cell states at single-cell resolution identifies in vivo state-dependence of eQTLs influencing disease

finding: The rs5848 variant was found to influence GRN mRNA levels in both brain and peripheral mononuclear cells in patients diagnosed with Alzheimer's Disease (AD). This SNP was also associated with reduced plasma and brain levels of granulin in AD patients, indicating its role in the pathophysiology of the disease. Moreover, studies highlighted that this variant posed a risk for Alzheimer’s Disease specifically within the Taiwanese population, showcasing its relevance across different demographics. A meta-analysis further correlated this polymorphism with neurodegenerative diseases, reinforcing its importance as a genetic risk factor.
title: Investigating the Role and Regulation of GPNMB in Progranulin-deficient Macrophages

finding: The SNP rs4792909 presented a GWAS association with P<sub>GWAS</sub> = 1.5E-74. It was linked to the gene G6PC3 in TWAS (P<sub>TWAS</sub> = 4.2E-26) at a distance of 349kb. Although no associated genes were reported near rs4792909 in GWAS, the SNP had a confirmed connection to bone mineral density through TWAS results.
title: Integrating genome-wide association and transcriptome predicted model identify novel target genes with osteoporosis

finding: The rs5848 SNP was identified as a risk factor for frontotemporal dementia (FTD) and Alzheimer's disease. In silico analyses indicated that this SNP affects the binding affinity of miR-659 to the GRN mRNA, with the T allele demonstrating stronger binding and increased translational repression. Individuals homozygous for the T allele (TT genotype) exhibited approximately 30% reduced levels of progranulin protein in both brain tissue and cerebrospinal fluid (CSF), suggesting that the miR-mediated modulation of progranulin levels significantly contributes to the risk of these neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Antisense oligonucleotides targeting the miR-29b binding site in the GRN mRNA increase progranulin translation

finding: The variant within the SLC16A11 gene (rs117767867) was associated with an increased risk of diabetes. It showed divergent allele frequencies based on aggregate estimates versus local ancestry in the Admixed American genetic ancestry group.
title: Improved Allele Frequencies in gnomAD through Local Ancestry Inference

finding: The rs563260668 variant, identified as SNV3, appeared to have polymorphic characteristics, being observed in the gnomAD database with a frequency of 1 in 152,152. This specific SNP was part of the Neanderthal-derived variants situated in the EC1.45 enhancer region. Its relevance lies in its potential association with Neanderthal-specific morphological traits, particularly alterations in jaw features that contribute to craniofacial development. The study emphasized the presence of this variant as derived in Neanderthal, suggesting its involvement in enhancing regulatory activity related to facial morphology.
title: Neanderthal-derived variants shape craniofacial enhancer activity at a human disease locus

finding: The rs201961848 (p.A204S) variant was linked to fasting glucose (FG) and fasting insulin (FI). It was part of novel associations detected in <italic>G6PC</italic>, which influenced metabolic traits in normoglycemic individuals.
title: Tissue-Specific Alteration of Metabolic Pathways Influences Glycemic Regulation

finding: The variant rs1801175 (p.R83C) was associated with fasting glucose (FG) and fasting insulin (FI) levels. It is known to be a loss-of-function variant, implicating it in glucose homeostasis.
title: Tissue-Specific Alteration of Metabolic Pathways Influences Glycemic Regulation

finding: The protein-truncating variant rs80356487 (p.Q347X) influenced fasting glucose (FG) and fasting insulin (FI) levels, suggesting its functional role in glucose regulation.
title: Tissue-Specific Alteration of Metabolic Pathways Influences Glycemic Regulation

finding: The SNP rs9747347 was significantly associated with hair color and myopia in Europeans. Specifically, the ancestral allele T was linked to red hair while the derived allele C was associated with brown and black hair. The finding indicated that selection favored the myopia risk allele in Europeans.
title: Detection of adaptation to light environment in myopia-associated loci Diversity of the myopia genetic background

finding: The SNP rs11655029 was associated with educational attainment (EA) and marked the peak association over the gene RAI1, which has been previously linked to autism spectrum disorder (ASD). Its p-value was reported as 2.84 x 10^-9, indicating a strong association with this phenotype.
title: An approach to gene-based testing accounting for dependence of tests among nearby genes

finding: The SNP rs4244599, which was identified as the index SNP for autism spectrum disorder (ASD), displayed a moderate association with p-value 0.0018 and peaked over TOM1L2, suggesting it may have implications in ASD despite not being as strongly associated as other SNPs.
title: An approach to gene-based testing accounting for dependence of tests among nearby genes

finding: The index SNP for schizophrenia (SCZ), rs8082590, had a noteworthy p-value of 6.02 x 10^-8 and correlated with its smoothed association signal over GID4, indicating an association with risk for schizophrenia.
title: An approach to gene-based testing accounting for dependence of tests among nearby genes

finding: The SNP rs74998289 was associated with educational attainment (EA) and surpassed the threshold for individual SNP significance with a p-value of 1.31 x 10^-17, which is significant for variation in the 17q21 locus.
title: An approach to gene-based testing accounting for dependence of tests among nearby genes

finding: The SNP rs12942300 approached significance for autism spectrum disorder (ASD) with a p-value of 2.06 x 10^-6, indicating its potential role in susceptibility to ASD within the 17q21 locus.
title: An approach to gene-based testing accounting for dependence of tests among nearby genes

finding: The rs2474694 A allele was linked to a higher risk of prostate cancer with a p-value of 3.22e-9 and an odds ratio of 1.09. Functional assays demonstrated that cells with the cut at this variant exhibited higher VPS53 expression, and A allele showed stronger transcription activity than the G allele across BPH1, DU145, and PC3 cells.
title: Identify Regulatory eQTLs by Multiome Sequencing in Prostate Single Cells

finding: The SNP rs9895127 was established as an index SNP associated with varicose veins (VVs) at locus 17q24.3, indicating its role in the genetic architecture of this disorder.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins

finding: The strongest association across all phenotypes was observed with the pulmonary root diameter linked to SNP rs17608766 (P = 1.9E-51), positioned near the GOSR2 gene, establishing its significance in cardiac morphology.
title: Genetic Analysis of Right Heart Structure and Function in 40,000 People

finding: rs2526377 was associated with hsa-miR-6761-3p in oligodendrocyte precursor cells (OPCs), with a nominal p-value of 5.90×10^-4. This microRNA was also previously implicated in AD pathology.
title: gsQTL: Associating genetic risk variants with gene sets by exploiting their shared variability

finding: The SNP rs11658786 was associated with a loss-of-binding effect on the SPI1 transcription factor in the STARD3 gene. AMBER-Seq predicted that the alternative allele (A) significantly reduced SPI1 binding compared to the G allele, a finding corroborated by independent ChIP-seq experiments showing that SPI1 predominantly binds to the G allele (85.2%) over the A allele (14.8%). This was critical in confirming the predictive accuracy of the AMBER-Seq model, highlighting its applicability in discerning variant effects that impact gene expression and transcription factor binding.
title: An automated framework for efficiently designing deep convolutional neural networks in genomics

finding: This SNP, characterized by a minor allele frequency of 0.0024 and a large effect size of -2.27, was notable for skewing variance estimates. However, the authors suspected the estimate was inflated and subsequently removed it from the analysis to refine the genetic variance calculations.
title: Interpreting SNP heritability in admixed populations

finding: The variant rs62061845 in the KANSL1 gene was identified with links to functional connectivity primarily in the default mode and salience networks, influencing cognitive functions and potentially relating to Parkinson’s disease.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic human brain functional networks

finding: In relation to rs12601611 found in the STAT3 locus, accessible chromatin regions in both macrophages and fibroblasts co-localized with specific IBD risk variants. Unlike LITAF, STAT3's region was not tissue-dependent in macrophages, yet it maintained robust expression across different immune cell subpopulations, illustrating its ongoing regulatory significance in IBD.
title: Accessible chromatin maps of inflammatory bowel disease intestine nominate cell-type mediators of genetic disease risk

finding: The SNP rs36186689, located in the MTRNR2L1-LOC105371703-MIR4522 locus, was connected to the genus Eggerthia. This association also extended to serum testosterone levels and work stress, showcasing its relevance to both microbial and physiological traits.
title: Metagenome-genome-wide association studies reveal human genetic impact on the oral microbiome

finding: Associations with rs113260531 indicated a genotype-driven regulation affecting ZNF232, showcasing the interplay between genotype and allelic expression in Alzheimer's disease genetics.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: The finding related to rs1800371 (G>A) indicated that this missense variant was present in patient A12 and was known to impair p53 function when only one mutated allele was retained. The context of this finding related to the analysis of the TP53 locus, where HATCHet2 identified clonal loss of heterozygosity (LOH). This was pertinent as TP53 mutations are commonly associated with early cancer progression.
title: HATCHet2: clone- and haplotype-specific copy number inference from bulk tumor sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs55714927, located in the ASGR1 gene, was identified as a pleiotropic synonymous variant that acts as both a splicing quantitative trait locus (sQTL) and an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL). It colocalized with a naturally variable exon (NVE) splice site, with the alternate allele associated with a 3-10% increase in the inclusion of the NVE. This variant was linked to phenotypes relating to cholesterol levels and heart function. Furthermore, a negative correlation was observed between the Ψ of this NVE and the expression of ASGR1, suggesting that the NVE might trigger nonsense-mediated decay (NMD). This illustrates the relevance of even low-frequency NVEs in the context of genetic variation.
title: Widespread naturally variable human exons aid genetic interpretation

finding: The SNP rs35392904 was significantly associated with periventricular white matter hyperintensities (PVWMH). It was located in the intronic region of the TRIM65 gene, with a genome-wide significance of p=3.989e-28.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: The intronic SNP rs3744020, located in the TRIM47 gene, was significantly associated with both PVWMH and DWMH, having been reported as genome-wide significant in earlier studies.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: This SNP, rs3744028, was identified in high LD with other significant SNPs in the TRIM47/TRIM65 locus, showing substantial association with both PVWMH and DWMH.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: The SNP rs7214628 shared significant relationships with other SNPs in the 17q25.1 locus, showing strong evidence of association with both types of white matter hyperintensities.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: The deepSNP rs2273030 in the SHMT1 locus was connected to MS through a QTL network, suggesting it alters TF YY1 binding, providing insights into its regulatory capacity.
title: DeepWAS: Multivariate genotype-phenotype associations by directly integrating regulatory information using deep learning

finding: SNP rs4925172 was part of a three-way QTL interaction network with rs2273030, revealing critical regulatory interactions relevant to MS.
title: DeepWAS: Multivariate genotype-phenotype associations by directly integrating regulatory information using deep learning

finding: The deepSNP rs7207666 exhibited joint regulatory effects alongside rs2273030 and rs4925172 in the context of MS, emphasizing its importance in disease mechanisms.
title: DeepWAS: Multivariate genotype-phenotype associations by directly integrating regulatory information using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs75615630 in the PRKCA gene was associated with once per week drinking (OWD). PRKCA is involved in neuronal development, synaptic signaling, and memory formation.
title: Genome-wide association study of alcohol consumption in Russian population

finding: The SNP site rs7216389 at the ORMDL3 locus was associated with the susceptibility to childhood asthma and virus-induced respiratory wheezing illnesses. This suggests that genetic variation at this locus may play a significant role in increasing the risk for these respiratory conditions in children.
title: ORMDL3 restrains type-I interferon signaling and anti-tumor immunity by promoting RIG-I degradation

finding: Found in PAFAH1B1, this SNP’s association with lissencephaly underscored its significance in central nervous system development.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: The rs2435204-G variant was found to correlate with reduced white matter surface area, tagging a well-known inversion at 17q21.31. This variant also displayed associations with brain structure phenotypes and was linked to neuroticism.
title: Deep learning based brain age prediction uncovers associated sequence variants

finding: The SNP rs55657917 was also identified as pleiotropic for breast cancer. Similar to rs11012732, its removal from the analyses did not significantly alter the observed inverse associations, reinforcing the evidence linking physical activity to reduced breast cancer risk.
title: Physical activity and risks of breast and colorectal cancer: A Mendelian randomization analysis

finding: The rs1800371 SNP, known as the Pro47Ser variant of the TP53 gene, was associated with increased cancer risk, specifically pre-menopausal breast cancer in African American women. This variant was predominantly found in African-descent populations, with a prevalence of approximately 1% in African Americans and 6% in sub-Saharan Africans. Additionally, studies demonstrated that the S47 variant led to altered regulation of the cystine importer SLC7A11, resulting in increased cysteine and glutathione accumulation in cells. Moreover, the S47 variant was linked to increased oxidative metabolism, larger body size, improved metabolic efficiency, and a higher incidence of spontaneous cancer such as liver cancer in mice.
title: Increased mTOR activity and metabolic efficiency in mouse and human cells containing the African-centric tumor-predisposing p53 variant Pro47Ser

finding: The SNP rs4430796 was highlighted for showing genetic associations and signals related to Type 2 diabetes and prostate cancer. It was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the gene MLLT6, indicating a possible regulatory role in the context of these diseases.
title: Genetic colocalization atlas points to common regulatory sites and genes for hematopoietic traits and hematopoietic contributions to disease phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs7501939 also exhibited significant genetic associations, with signals related to various indicated traits. This SNP was identified as an eQTL for the gene ARHGAP23, suggesting its involvement in the regulation of pathways connected to the associated phenotypes.
title: Genetic colocalization atlas points to common regulatory sites and genes for hematopoietic traits and hematopoietic contributions to disease phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs11077850 on chromosome 17 colocalized with an edQTL and was linked to macular telangiectasia (MacTel). This edQTL was connected to increased editing in the PRCD transcript, which is relevant to Progressive Rod-Cone Degeneration.
title: The retinal RNA editome is concentrated in photoreceptor-specific genes and genetically linked to vision loss

finding: rs6504682 was analyzed as a major instrument in the reconstruction of the <italic>LUC7L3</italic> sub-network and revealed its link to gene regulation in visceral abdominal fat.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: The variant rs372467471, located in the UNC13D gene (NM_199242: c.1889C>T, p.A630V), was associated with a rare, life-threatening hyper-inflammatory immune disorder called hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis (HLH). This variant was identified as homozygous in all archaic human genomes and was notable for its low allele frequency in the gnomAD database. It had not been previously reported in modern human genomes.
title: Did variants in inborn errors of immunity genes contribute to the extinction of Neanderthals?

finding: The variant rs147748627, also in the UNC13D gene (NM_199242: c.2828A>G, p.N943S), was linked to hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis (HLH) and had been previously reported in patients with this condition. Like rs372467471, this variant was present as homozygous in all archaic genomes and was noted for its low allele frequency in the population database.
title: Did variants in inborn errors of immunity genes contribute to the extinction of Neanderthals?

finding: The SNP rs56014026 was identified as a heterozygous polymorphism in the P32/C1QBP/HABP1 gene. It was found to reduce mitochondrial oxidative phosphorylation specifically and was expressed in low-grade colorectal carcinomas. This finding highlighted the potential influence of this SNP on cancer biology and its relevance in colorectal cancer pathogenesis.
title: The zebrafish as a new model for studying chaperone-mediated autophagy unveils its role in spermatogenesis

finding: The study identified the rs111653425 variant as a missense mutation (p.Ala465Val) in the SLC47A1 gene, which was associated with Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) in a Pakistani population. Statistical analysis showed a significant genotypic association with CKD, as indicated by a Chi-square p-value of 0.03274 and an odds ratio of 3.244, suggesting the mutant allele was almost three times more prevalent in cases compared to controls. This variant disrupted the function of the MATE1 protein, resulting in elevated serum creatinine levels and subsequent renal damage.
title: Genetic Association of SLC47A1 Gene Variant (17:19571562C >T) and Bioinformatics Analyses of MATE1 Protein in Chronic Kidney Disease Patients of Pakistani Origin

finding: The analysis revealed the presence of rs2632516, a variant associated with Alzheimer's disease susceptibility, located upstream of the miR-142 gene on the negative strand. This polymorphism may influence the transcriptional regulation of miR-142, which was identified as one of the downregulated differentially expressed miRNAs in the brain area of Alzheimer’s disease patients. Prior research indicated that the presence of the rs2632516 variant allele in patients with systemic lupus erythematosus correlated with decreased miR-142 expression, supporting its potential significance in Alzheimer’s disease pathology.
title: MIRit: an integrative R framework for the identification of impaired miRNA-mRNA regulatory networks in complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs75493593 at the SLC16A11 locus was identified as the top SNP associated with type 2 diabetes. It showed an overall frequency of 36%, with population-specific frequencies of 0.1% in African, 0.7% in European, and 53% in Native Mexican populations, aligning with previous reports from the SIGMA Type 2 Diabetes Consortium.
title: Genotyping, sequencing and analysis of 140,000 adults from the Mexico City Prospective Study

finding: The SNP rs35546597 was identified near the AURKB locus, showing a p-value of 1.88×10−8 in the analysis of self-reported anxiety disorders. This suggests a genetic underpinning related to cell cycle regulation within psychiatric contexts.
title: Reproducible Risk Loci and Psychiatric Comorbidities in Anxiety: Results from ~200,000 Million Veteran Program Participants

finding: The SNP rs883871 was identified as a strong eQTL for both THRA and NR1B1 in East Africans. It was significant in GTEx analyses, disrupting a nucleotide for the core ETS-family transcription factor motif. This SNP was linked with Multiple Sclerosis in GWAS, indicating a potential role in gene regulation relevant to autoimmune conditions.
title: The Genetic and Evolutionary Basis of Gene Expression Variation in East Africans

finding: The SNP rs1799752, which relates to the ACE I/D polymorphism, was associated with the risk of myocardial infarction according to earlier studies and meta-analysis data. This specific finding highlighted its relevance in coronary heart disease.
title: Mathematical modeling of the influence of ACE I/D polymorphism on blood pressure and antihypertensive therapy

finding: The SNP rs78378222, located in the 3'-UTR of the p53 gene, was associated with altered cancer risk depending on the p53 mutational status. Specifically, the minor C-allele correlated with increased cancer risk in ER+ Breast Cancer (ER+BC) and Low-Grade Serous Ovarian Cancer (LGSOC), while it was linked to decreased risk in ER- Breast Cancer (ER-BC) and High-Grade Serous Ovarian Cancer (HGSOC). This association persisted even after multiple hypothesis correction and was shown to be significant in both blood samples (p=2.0e-25) and tumor datasets (p=1.7e-04). Furthermore, the minor C-allele consistently associated with reduced p53 expression levels across different tumor types, highlighting its potential role in breast and ovarian cancers with varying p53 mutation occurrences.
title: Germline and somatic genetic variants in the p53 pathway interact to affect cancer risk, progression and drug response

finding: SCIMP-rs7225151 showed a genome-wide significant association with LOAD when combining the GR@ACE dataset with IGAP I and II summary statistics, evidenced by an odds ratio of 1.11 and a p-value of 1.12 x 10^-8. This SNP had been reported as suggestive in previous work.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of dementia and its clinical endophenotypes reveal novel loci associated with Alzheimer’s disease and three causality networks of AD: the GR@ACE project

finding: MAPT-rs2732703 was reported to be statistically significant, particularly among APOE ε4 non-carriers, as part of the prevalent genetic associations with Alzheimer's.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of dementia and its clinical endophenotypes reveal novel loci associated with Alzheimer’s disease and three causality networks of AD: the GR@ACE project

finding: The rs5848 SNP in the GRN gene was associated with neurodegenerative diseases, particularly in a Taiwanese population where its role was linked to Parkinson’s disease. A meta-analysis confirmed the association of this polymorphism with various neurodegenerative conditions, highlighting its significance in the context of GRN-related pathologies.
title: Progranulin deficiency leads to reduced glucocerebrosidase activity

finding: The variant rs971292786-C was associated with levels of calcification in coronary arteries, with a beta of 0.51 and a P-value of 1.9 × 10^-7. This finding aligned with a result from a PheWAS conducted in FinnGen, where it was also associated with coronary angioplasty, indicating a consistent direction of effect. Coronary angioplasty is a primary surgical procedure for treating atherosclerotic arteries.
title: Self-supervised learning for characterising histomorphological diversity and spatial RNA expression prediction across 23 human tissue types

finding: The rs17886183 SNP in the SOST 3'UTR was linked to bone mineral density (BMD) changes, observed in a cohort of postmenopausal women. Specifically, carriers of the heterozygous mutation had a mean BMD value of 0.889 g/cm² compared to 0.850 g/cm² for those with the reference allele, suggesting that this variant played a role in higher BMD, consistent with literature showing its association with extreme high-low BMD profiles.
title: Human-derived alleles in SOST and RUNX2 3′UTRs cause differential regulation in a bone cell-line model

finding: The rs117190076 SNP was associated with a missense mutation in the RPH3AL gene, which was significantly downregulated in induced neurons (iNs) from people living with HIV (PLWH) compared to those without HIV (PWOH). This mutation was previously linked to an increased risk for late-onset Alzheimer’s disease, suggesting that downregulation of the genomic locus containing RPH3AL may impact synaptic vesicle release pathways relevant to neurocognitive impairments observed in PLWH.
title: A Transcriptional Signature of Induced Neurons Differentiates Virologically Suppressed People Living With HIV from People Without HIV

finding: The rs80357971 variant was similarly identified as a germline frameshift variant located in the BRCA1 gene in the BCAC cohort, specifically in the patient PD56542. This variant, like its counterpart, is also classified as a pathogenic breast and/or ovarian cancer susceptibility variant in the ClinVar database, further supporting its role in cancer risk. The patient’s tumour exhibited a somatic loss of 16q, reflecting similar genetic alterations as seen with rs80357906.
title: Activation of Wnt/β-catenin signalling by mutually exclusive FBXW11 and CTNNB1 hotspot mutations drives salivary gland basal cell adenoma

finding: The SNP rs10451283 was associated with the LINC02210-CRHR1 locus, frequently identified through fine mapping as connected to white matter variations and potentially linked to brain disorders.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: The variant rs9897399 was found to be frequently fine-mapped in relation to white matter traits, underscoring its relevance in the genetic architecture of brain-related phenotypes.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: The SNP rs242561 was identified as linked to the MAPT locus, highlighting its significance as a fine-mapped variant within the genetic architecture of white matter.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: The variant rs62062794 was frequently found to be associated with DTI parameters, indicating its potential causal role in understanding white matter genetics.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: The SNP rs199510 was noted for its frequent association with WNT3 locus and white matter traits, reflecting its potential implications in brain-related phenotypes.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: The variant rs70600 was frequently fine-mapped as part of the genetic analysis regarding white matter microstructure, suggesting its relevance in the study of brain disorders.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: The SNP rs70602 was found to be associated with WNT3, being an important fine-mapped variant influencing white matter characteristics and potential brain function.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: In the study, it was demonstrated that the PD risk variant rs1109303 significantly influenced the expression of SATB1, which regulated the downregulation of GBA through the microRNA gene MIR22HG. This regulatory relationship contributed to the accumulation of glucocerebrosides (GluCer) and was implicated in the dysregulation of cellular functions associated with Parkinson's Disease.
title: The SATB1-MIR22-GBA axis mediates glucocerebroside accumulation inducing a cellular senescence-like phenotype in dopaminergic neurons

finding: The rs74999341 T/C SNP was specifically analyzed concerning its relation to SOX9 expression in patients with Pierre Robin sequence (PRS). This SNP was targeted using LNA probes to differentiate between the T-allele and C-allele, facilitating investigations into gene expression levels. The findings highlighted the role of this genetic variant in the regulation of SOX9, contributing to the understanding of the genetic mechanisms in PRS.
title: Structural elements facilitate extreme long-range gene regulation at a human disease locus

finding: The variant rs8078228 was identified as a pleiotropic variant in the analysis of lifetime smoking's effects on WHR<sub>adjBMI</sub>. This suggests it could play a role in moderating the association between smoking and abdominal obesity.
title: Estimating the causal relationship between smoking and abdominal adiposity using Mendelian randomization

finding: The SNP rs56750287 was recognized as an eQTL for ORMDL3 in CD8+ T GZMKhi cells and had high posterior probabilities for colocalization with rheumatoid arthritis variants. This finding highlighted its potential role in inflammatory diseases, including childhood-onset asthma.
title: Single-cell analysis of human diversity in circulating immune cells

finding: The SNP rs5848 was associated with an increased risk of Alzheimer's disease, as reported by Sheng et al. in 2014. The loss of the progranulin protein, which is impacted by this variant, was noted to have connections to neurodegenerative diseases. Additionally, a study by Kamalainen et al. in 2013 indicated that this GRN variant reduces plasma and brain levels of granulin in Alzheimer’s disease patients. This suggests a direct link between the rs5848 variant and the pathology associated with Alzheimer's disease, emphasizing the role of lysosomal health and granulin in myeloid cell function in neurodegeneration.
title: Lysosomes cell autonomously regulate myeloid cell states and immune responses

finding: The missense variant rs34562254 in the TNFRSF13B locus was specifically associated with SLE in Chinese populations, demonstrating an OR of 1.18 with a P-value of 2.88E-08. In contrast, this variant was not significantly associated with SLE in European populations, where it showed an OR of 1.01 (P=0.75), indicating ancestry-specific relevance.
title: Identification of 38 novel loci for systemic lupus erythematosus and genetic heterogeneity that may underly population disparities in this disease

finding: The study found a significant association between the homozygous mutant variant Pro/Pro of the p53 codon 72 SNP (rs1042522) and increased incidence in esophageal cancer patients, with occurrences of 20 patients (71.4%) in the cancer group compared to 1 patient (10%) in the healthy control group (p=0.0026).
title: Genetic analysis of TP53 gene mutations in exon 4 and exon 8 among esophageal cancer patients in Sudan

finding: The study reported that the variant noted as VAR_019660 corresponding to p.Arg5His, had the annotation indicating its impact in Frontotemporal Dementia (FTD) where it reduced the ability of tau to promote microtubule assembly and instead promoted fibril formation in vitro. This variant's presence linked to the disorder provided essential insights into the molecular mechanisms of Alzheimer's disease and related dementias.
title: eMIND: Enabling automatic collection of protein variation impacts in Alzheimer’s disease from the literature

finding: The rs1042522 polymorphism in TP53 was investigated and found to have associations with breast cancer phenotype and prognosis.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The SNP rs744166 was associated with increased tyrosine phosphorylation of the transcription factor STAT3 in IL-23 responsive innate lymphoid cells. This finding suggested a pivotal role of this genotypic variant in the pathogenesis of Crohn's Disease, linking innate lymphoid cells to autoimmune response mechanisms.
title: Involvement of ILC1-like innate lymphocytes in human autoimmunity, lessons from alopecia areata

finding: The SNP rs8070069 was positively associated with the research on Wnt lipidation and its modifiers in the context of intestinal carcinogenesis and cancer, as described in the publication by Kaemmerer and Gassler (2016). This finding contributed to understanding the role of lipidation pathways in cancer development.
title: A bioorthogonal chemical reporter for fatty acid synthase-dependent protein acylation

finding: The SNP rs76774446 on chromosome 17 was identified with sub-genome-wide significance within the GOSR2 locus, showing a consistent odds ratio of 1.60 (p=9.95×10−8) in patients with anomalies of thoracic arteries and veins (ATAV).
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: The SNP rs11874 on chromosome 17 also showed sub-genome-wide significance within the GOSR2 locus, with an odds ratio of 1.60 (p=6.64×10−8), implicated in ATAV.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: The SNP rs17677363 located in the GOSR2 locus on chromosome 17 displayed sub-genome-wide significance, again with an odds ratio of 1.60 (p=9.81×10−8) in ATAV patients.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: The SNP rs138741144 was evident on chromosome 17 near the ASIC2 locus, contributing to the data on septal defects.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: The variant rs4430796 was found to be reproducibly associated with prostate cancer (PCa) susceptibility, indicating its relevance in genetic risk factors and its impact on disease predisposition.
title: Extensive germline-somatic interplay drives prostate cancer through HNF1B co-option of TMPRSS2-ERG

finding: As a part of the 17q12/HNF1B locus, rs11263763 was identified as one of the critical SNPs associated with PCa risk through comprehensive GWAS analyses.
title: Extensive germline-somatic interplay drives prostate cancer through HNF1B co-option of TMPRSS2-ERG

finding: The SNP rs11651052, along with other variants in the 17q12/HNF1B locus, demonstrated a significant correlation with the susceptibility to prostate cancer, highlighting its role in disease genetics.
title: Extensive germline-somatic interplay drives prostate cancer through HNF1B co-option of TMPRSS2-ERG

finding: This SNP was shown to exhibit enhancer-like function, as analysis revealed it activated transcription in response to regulatory elements, emphasizing its influence on the expression of genes associated with PCa.
title: Extensive germline-somatic interplay drives prostate cancer through HNF1B co-option of TMPRSS2-ERG

finding: The rs9901746 variant was implicated in enhancing expression linking to PCa-related genes, indicating its potential role as a regulatory element within the HNF1B locus.
title: Extensive germline-somatic interplay drives prostate cancer through HNF1B co-option of TMPRSS2-ERG

finding: Evidence pointed to rs12453443 as a significant enhancer for the HNF1B promoter, underlining its importance in the genetics associated with prostate cancer.
title: Extensive germline-somatic interplay drives prostate cancer through HNF1B co-option of TMPRSS2-ERG

finding: The variant rs718960 was associated with significant enhancer activity, indicating its potential to regulate transcription of related genes and its involvement in PCa susceptibility.
title: Extensive germline-somatic interplay drives prostate cancer through HNF1B co-option of TMPRSS2-ERG

finding: This SNP was identified as being strongly associated with prostate cancer susceptibility and shown to alter the HNF1B-ERG interaction, thereby emphasizing its regulatory functions.
title: Extensive germline-somatic interplay drives prostate cancer through HNF1B co-option of TMPRSS2-ERG

finding: At the 17p13.3 locus, rs2955626 demonstrated significant enhancer activity affecting the expression of VPS53, FAM57A, and GEMIN4, linking it to risk factors for prostate cancer.
title: Extensive germline-somatic interplay drives prostate cancer through HNF1B co-option of TMPRSS2-ERG

finding: The rs461251 SNP displayed enhancer-like activity, contributing to the regulation of multiple prostate cancer risk-associated genes at the 17p13.3 locus.
title: Extensive germline-somatic interplay drives prostate cancer through HNF1B co-option of TMPRSS2-ERG

finding: This SNP was most significant for autism spectrum disorder (ASD), linked to whole brainstem volume, and had a nearest gene MAPT related to various neural processes.
title: The genetic architecture of human brainstem structures and their involvement in common brain disorders

finding: Noted to be shared between ASD and SCZ, it was associated with medulla oblongata volume. The nearest gene KANSL1 plays a role in histone acetylation within the brain.
title: The genetic architecture of human brainstem structures and their involvement in common brain disorders

finding: This SNP was linked to SCZ and medulla oblongata volume, with its nearby gene also being KANSL1, indicating its involvement in common brain disorders.
title: The genetic architecture of human brainstem structures and their involvement in common brain disorders

finding: The TP53 noncoding variant rs78378222[C] was found to be positively associated with an increased risk for soft tissue sarcoma, with an odds ratio (OR) of 4.55 and a p-value of 3.3 x 10^-5. It also conferred a moderate risk of developing brain tumors, particularly glioma, while providing protection against breast cancer (OR = 0.573, P = 0.0078). This variant was observed to increase susceptibility to neoplasms such as brain, colon, and prostate tumors in a mouse model. Findings indicated that this SNP behaved differently compared to typical Li-Fraumeni syndrome (LFS) mutations, as it did not confer the same vulnerability to breast cancer but sustained connections to brain tumor predisposition.
title: Tissue-specific MicroRNA Expression Alters Cancer Susceptibility Conferred by a TP53 Noncoding Variant

finding: The SNP rs2532404 was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) that regulated KANSL1 expression in induced pluripotent stem cell-derived neurons. It was shown to be associated with progressive supranuclear palsy, indicating its relevance in neurodevelopmental processes and intellectual disability in the context of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Single nucleus multiomics identifies ZEB1 and MAFB as candidate regulators of Alzheimer’s disease-specific cis regulatory elements

finding: This SNP was identified as a significant allelic hit related to the gene ORMDL3, which had been associated with asthma susceptibility. It was shown to drive ORMDL3 expression, providing evidence supporting its role as a causal variant in asthma.
title: Multiple Causal Variants Underlie Genetic Associations in Humans

finding: The finding related to SNP rs3027172 indicated that the PER1 genotype interacted with early life stress to predict problematic alcohol use. However, it was noted that this SNP did not have a predictive effect on reward-related ventral striatum activity. This study suggested differential impacts of genetic predispositions on behavior and neurobiological responses.
title: The longitudinal stability of fMRI activation during reward processing in adolescents and young adults

finding: The findings showed that the sequence ars2-3358 (also indicated by SNP rs2009) was a parental plasmid used for cloning and further analysis regarding ARS activity, indicating its importance as an origin of replication.
title: Characterization of DNA replicators of a 75-kb region of Chromosome 2 of fission yeast, Schizosacharomyces pombe

finding: The SNP rs11575895 was part of the highly pleiotropic MAPT-CRHR1 locus, identified as significant for multiple addiction traits. It was noted for having strong predicted differential activity across both cortical excitatory and striatal cell types, showcasing its complex role in addiction genetic predisposition.
title: Addiction-associated genetic variants implicate brain cell type- and region-specific cis-regulatory elements in addiction neurobiology

finding: Similar to rs11575895, the SNP rs62056779 was located within the MAPT-CRHR1 locus and exhibited genome-wide significance for five out of seven addiction-associated traits, suggesting its potential functional impact across multiple neuronal cell types.
title: Addiction-associated genetic variants implicate brain cell type- and region-specific cis-regulatory elements in addiction neurobiology

finding: The variant rs228271 was identified as a significant conditional allele-specific effect (cASE) variant and a fine-mapped artery eQTL that was predicted to affect transcription factor binding for E2F1 and E2F4. Studies showed that the alternate allele of rs228271 resulted in stronger binding of these transcription factors, thereby increasing activity linked to PIP4K2B. Higher expression of PIP4K2B was associated with hypertension. Interestingly, in the presence of caffeine, the expression of E2F1 and E2F4 was downregulated, which led to decreased regulatory activity associated with rs228271 and mitigated the genetic risk of hypertension in individuals with the AA genotype, demonstrating a protective effect of caffeine against hypertension risk. This finding illustrates the importance of considering environmental contexts when studying genetic influences on complex traits.
title: Characterization of caffeine response regulatory variants in vascular endothelial cells

finding: This SNP was associated with chronic inflammatory disease (CRD), multiple sclerosis (MS), and ulcerative colitis (ULC), indicating its broad relevance in autoimmune genetics.
title: Unravelling the shared genetic mechanisms underlying 18 autoimmune diseases using a systems approach

finding: It was found to be linked with rheumatoid arthritis (RA) and ulcerative colitis (ULC), demonstrating its role in connecting different autoimmune diseases.
title: Unravelling the shared genetic mechanisms underlying 18 autoimmune diseases using a systems approach

finding: This SNP was linked to systemic sclerosis (SSC) and highlighted the genetic risk factors contributing to immune response dysregulation in AiDs.
title: Unravelling the shared genetic mechanisms underlying 18 autoimmune diseases using a systems approach

finding: Associated with type 1 diabetes (TID), this SNP provided insights into shared immune mechanisms across various autoimmune afflictions.
title: Unravelling the shared genetic mechanisms underlying 18 autoimmune diseases using a systems approach

finding: The SNP rs11080327 was the most significantly associated cis-eQTL outside of the MHC region, linked with expression of SLFN5, an ISG. The association was strong in the context of IAV infection, indicating that higher SLFN5 expression correlates with IAV susceptibility.
title: Single-cell genome-wide association reveals a nonsynonymous variant in ERAP1 confers increased susceptibility to influenza virus

finding: Variation in LOX12 (rs12232535) was associated with the potentiation of IL-6 in the in vitro BCG trained immunity model, highlighting its significant contribution to the regulation of inflammatory cytokines in this context.
title: Fatty acid desaturation and lipoxygenase pathways support trained immunity

finding: Variations in LOX12 (rs955461) were associated with the increased fold change of IL-6 after BCG vaccination, emphasizing the SNP's relevance in modulating immune responses to vaccination.
title: Fatty acid desaturation and lipoxygenase pathways support trained immunity

finding: Emerging as a risk factor for breast, prostate, and endometrial cancers, this SNP was part of an intronic variant associated with hormone-related cancers.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: This SNP was determined to be correlated with bone mineral density and was protective against several hormone-related cancers.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: This SNP associated with a protective effect against HGSOC but conferred susceptibility to ER-positive breast cancer and prostate cancer.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs1805462 was linked to differential expression of eQTL genes between human and macaque LCLs. It was also associated with variations in quantitative blood traits, demonstrating its relevance to human-specific phenotypic outcomes.
title: Human gene regulatory evolution is driven by the divergence of regulatory element function in both cis and trans

finding: The missense allele rs9730 in the ARHGAP27 gene, which encodes a Rho GTPase, was found to increase NEB while concomitantly being associated with a shorter reproductive lifespan. It was significantly linked to later age at menarche, earlier menopause, and variations in testosterone levels in both women and men.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies genetic effects on reproductive success and ongoing natural selection at the FADS locus

finding: The rs12939435 variant exhibited a strong genotype-dependent effect on 5mC levels at the CD300A locus, influenced by the proportion of CD8+ T cells. The interaction showed a significant impact on DNA methylation, highlighting the importance of cellular composition and genetic factors in immune response regulation.
title: Factors Driving DNA Methylation Variation in Human Blood

finding: The rs11653735 variant in the CSNK1D gene was significantly associated with urea levels, indicating a novel connection to kidney function despite no classic ciliopathy syndrome associated with this gene.
title: Mendelian pathway analysis of laboratory traits reveals distinct roles for ciliary subcompartments in common disease pathogenesis

finding: In the context of the 17q12-21.1 locus, rs2941522 was identified as a cis-eQTL influencing the expression of both ORMDL3 and IKZF3, which are significantly associated with asthma and autoimmune diseases.
title: Vitamin D constrains inflammation by modulating the expression of key genes on Chr17q12-21.1

finding: This SNP was also found to be a cis-eQTL affecting the expression of ORMDL3 and IKZF3 within the 17q12-21.1 locus, linking it to previous associations with autoimmune diseases.
title: Vitamin D constrains inflammation by modulating the expression of key genes on Chr17q12-21.1

finding: Similar to the other SNPs in the 17q12-21.1 region, rs1453559 served as a cis-eQTL for ORMDL3 and related genes, highlighting its role in asthma and autoimmune disease predisposition.
title: Vitamin D constrains inflammation by modulating the expression of key genes on Chr17q12-21.1

finding: The variant rs752560074 in TSPOAP1 was found to be homozygous in the affected siblings of Family C and was predicted pathogenic by various in silico tools. This variant was established as a novel genetic cause of autosomal recessive dystonia, as it was linked to the phenotype characterized by juvenile-onset progressive generalized dystonia, alongside presenting other features like intellectual disability and cerebellar atrophy.
title: Bi-allelic variants in TSPOAP1, encoding the active zone protein RIMBP1, cause autosomal recessive dystonia

finding: The SNP rs2008012 was identified as having a hyperoxia-specific association with the expression of H3F3B in immature excitatory neurons. This finding was significant as it differed from traditional eQTL mapping, which indicated an oxygen-insensitive effect in dividing intermediate progenitors. This SNP was associated with the variation in the uncinate fasciculus white matter, connecting the limbic system to the frontal lobes, and had previously been described as an eQTL for several genes primarily in blood.
title: Oxygen-induced stress reveals context-specific gene regulatory effects in human brain organoids

finding: In the UK Biobank cohort, rs12453010 was identified in an intergenic region on chromosome 17 with a significant association to neck or shoulder pain, having a P-value of 1.66 x 10^-11. This locus was noted as the most significant, although it was not replicated in subsequent studies.
title: A genome-wide association study finds genetic variants associated with neck or shoulder pain in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs11871958 was associated with alternative splicing of the SNHG29 gene and overlapped an AATF binding site. The minor C allele was linked to decreased PSI of the associated intron junction. AATF gene expression correlated significantly with the PSI, supporting AATF's role in this splicing event, which has implications for the Wnt/beta-catenin signaling pathway related to osteoarthritis (OA).
title: Response splicing QTLs in primary human chondrocytes identifies putative osteoarthritis risk genes

finding: The CCL5 rs2107538 polymorphism was implicated in the risk of cardiovascular disease, indicating its relevance in inflammatory processes affecting cardiovascular health.
title: Identification of biomarkers and pathways for focal segmental glomerulosclerosis using next generation sequencing data and bioinformatics analysis

finding: The CCL2 rs3760396 SNP was associated with cardiovascular disease risk, suggesting a role in the inflammatory response related to cardiovascular conditions.
title: Identification of biomarkers and pathways for focal segmental glomerulosclerosis using next generation sequencing data and bioinformatics analysis

finding: The IKZF3 rs12946510 polymorphism was associated with multiple sclerosis severity, reinforcing genetic contributions to immune-mediated disorders.
title: Identification of biomarkers and pathways for focal segmental glomerulosclerosis using next generation sequencing data and bioinformatics analysis

finding: SNP rs13900 in MCP1 was identified as showing significant variation and opposing major alleles between Memphis and Nicaragua populations, indicating genetic differences in immune-related genes with functional consequences due to ancestry.
title: Integrated Drivers of Basal and Acute Immunity in Diverse Human Populations

finding: The rs2107538 polymorphism of CCL5 was associated with an increased risk of cardiovascular disease, underlining the potential link between inflammatory pathways and metabolic disorders like NAFLD.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of differentially expressed genes in non alcoholic fatty liver disease using next generation sequencing data

finding: The CCL2 rs3760396 gene polymorphism showed an association with the risk of cardiovascular diseases, reinforcing the idea of inflammatory mechanisms being relevant in metabolic conditions, including NAFLD.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of differentially expressed genes in non alcoholic fatty liver disease using next generation sequencing data

finding: SNP rs7212798 was shown to be associated with the expression of BCAS3, supporting prior GWAS annotations through QTL analysis.
title: Interpreting coronary artery disease GWAS results: A functional genomics approach assessing biological significance

finding: The SNP rs11650008 was associated with ALS risk in a cross-ancestry GWAS involving 13,811 sporadic ALS cases and 26,350 controls, showing a p-value of 8.6 x 10^-8. Further analyses on the latest and largest ALS GWAS dataset indicated that this SNP is an intronic variant of the neighboring gene PIGW. The gene-based tests identified GGNBP2 as the most significant gene in that region associated with ALS, retaining genome-wide significance with a p-value of 6.6 x 10^-7. Moreover, eQTL data revealed that GGNBP2 exhibited the largest change in gene expression compared to the non-risk allele and the lowest SMR p-value, affirming its prominent role in ALS pathogenesis.
title: Ggnbp2 regulates synaptic development and autophagy in motor neurons

finding: In the study, rs111392251 was identified as a SigVar within the promoter of PLEKHM1, predicted to disrupt IRF-family TFs, highlighting its potential role in PSP risk.
title: Functional regulatory variants implicate distinct transcriptional networks in dementia

finding: The T allele of rs12948220 demonstrated a significant positive correlation with TRPV3 expression, particularly in a specific chondrocyte subtype, highlighting its importance in the differential regulation of gene expression in osteoarthritis.
title: Comprehensive profiling of transcriptional regulation in cartilage reveals pathogenesis of osteoarthritis

finding: The SNP rs2107538 was associated with the CCL5 gene and showed a significant link to type 2 diabetes mellitus in a study involving Saudi patients. This finding provided novel insights into the genetic underpinnings of chronic inflammation related to diabetes, particularly highlighting the role of CCL5 in the inflammatory pathways involved in IVD degeneration and related pain syndromes.
title: Secreted chemokines reveal diverse inflammatory and degenerative processes in the intervertebral disc of the STZ-HFD mouse model of Type 2 diabetes

finding: A missense mutation at position 291, which corresponds to dbSNP:rs372613518, was identified in patient 18. This mutation changed a Lysine to a Threonine and could disrupt the interaction between DNA binding domains of the TP53 protein, likely affecting its function and contributing to tumorigenesis.
title: Genetic analysis of TP53 gene mutations in exon 4 and exon 8 among esophageal cancer patients in Sudan

finding: Patient 18 also had a related somatic mutation at position 291 that corresponds to dbSNP:rs781490101, which is located in a region relevant to known splice variants and has been implicated in sporadic cancers. This mutation may play a role in the development of esophageal carcinoma.
title: Genetic analysis of TP53 gene mutations in exon 4 and exon 8 among esophageal cancer patients in Sudan

finding: The SNP rs3936197 in the MED24 gene was shown to have a significant association with white blood cell count, reporting a p-value of 5.18e-289 and a beta coefficient of -0.0772, indicating its population-enriched genetic associations.
title: Low generalizability of polygenic scores in African populations due to genetic and environmental diversity

finding: The SNP rs55751924 was found to be associated with the anteromedial temporal area on chromosome 17q21.31, yielding a highly significant p-value of 1.33e-61 and accounting for 0.84% of the variance in GWASg+r analyses.
title: Larger cerebral cortex is genetically correlated with greater frontal area and dorsal thickness

finding: SNP rs593720 was linked to total surface area within the chromosome 17q21.31 region, demonstrating a p-value of 4.94e-33 and explaining 0.44% of the variance in global surface area measurements.
title: Larger cerebral cortex is genetically correlated with greater frontal area and dorsal thickness

finding: The study indicated that the rs5848 T allele of the GRN gene had a significant association with increased risks of Alzheimer's disease (AD). It was proposed that this allele could exacerbate disinhibited behaviors in individuals with AD and increase tau inclusions, indicating a potential mechanism for the observed symptoms. The research highlighted the relevance of PGRN haploinsufficiency, as observed in mouse models, which closely mirrored the effects of this SNP in human AD.
title: Reduced progranulin increases tau and α-synuclein inclusions and alters phenotypes of tauopathy mice via glucocerebrosidase

finding: The rs2269906 variant was identified within the novel multi-signal locus associated with PD. It was linked to the genes UBTF and GRN, the latter being previously associated with frontotemporal dementia (FTD) and neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis.
title: Expanding Parkinson’s disease genetics: novel risk loci, genomic context, causal insights and heritable risk

finding: The variant rs850738 was identified as an independent risk SNP in the novel multi-signal locus along with rs2269906, with potential implications for the gene FAM171A2, which was connected to the GRN gene, noted for its role in frontotemporal dementia (FTD).
title: Expanding Parkinson’s disease genetics: novel risk loci, genomic context, causal insights and heritable risk

finding: The SNP rs676387 was linked to eczema and located within the HSD17B1 locus. This SNP was novel compared to past GWAS findings.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of 350,000 Caucasians from the UK Biobank identifies novel loci for asthma, hay fever and eczema

finding: This SNP, a proxy to the SLE sentinel SNP rs12938617, was found within the first intron of IKZF3, interacting with its promoter and also with the promoters of the distant genes PGAP3 and ERBB2.
title: Human follicular helper T cell promoter connectomes reveal novel genes and regulatory elements at SLE GWAS loci

finding: As a sentinel SLE associated SNP, rs12938617 was linked to rs112677036, elucidating its connection to the gene IKZF3 and its influence on downstream gene interactions.
title: Human follicular helper T cell promoter connectomes reveal novel genes and regulatory elements at SLE GWAS loci

finding: As another SNP implicating potential drug targets, this variant contributed to the framework of understanding TFH interactions linked to SLE.
title: Human follicular helper T cell promoter connectomes reveal novel genes and regulatory elements at SLE GWAS loci

finding: This SNP emerged as a significant factor in exploring gene regulatory interactions pertinent to SLE pathology.
title: Human follicular helper T cell promoter connectomes reveal novel genes and regulatory elements at SLE GWAS loci

finding: The missense SNP rs2071214 of the BIRC5 gene was associated with an increased risk of intracerebral hemorrhage in the Korean population.
title: Bioinformatics and next generation data analysis reveals the potential role of inflammation in sepsis and its associated complications

finding: The SNP rs17651213 was shown to regulate the haplotype-specific splicing of MAPT isoforms under basal conditions. This finding was significant as it provided evidence for the genetic association between the H1 haplotype and increased risk for neurodegenerative disorders including Progressive Supranuclear Palsy and Parkinson’s disease.
title: Rescue of the increased susceptibility to Mild Chronic Oxidative Stress of iNeurons carrying the MAPT Chromosome 17q21.3 H1/H1 risk allele by FDA-approved compounds

finding: Similar to rs17651213, SNP rs1800547 was identified as a modulator of MAPT expression, influencing the splicing of MAPT isoforms. This finding further reinforced the association of the H1 haplotype with various neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Rescue of the increased susceptibility to Mild Chronic Oxidative Stress of iNeurons carrying the MAPT Chromosome 17q21.3 H1/H1 risk allele by FDA-approved compounds

finding: SNP rs242561 was identified in a genome-wide association study where it was correlated with NRF2/sMAF occupancy, suggesting its role in disease risk. This SNP, located on a cis-acting enhancer, was associated with the protective effects against oxidative stress in the context of the H2 haplotype.
title: Rescue of the increased susceptibility to Mild Chronic Oxidative Stress of iNeurons carrying the MAPT Chromosome 17q21.3 H1/H1 risk allele by FDA-approved compounds

finding: The polymorphism of SREBF1 gene rs11868035 G/A was found to be associated with susceptibility to Parkinson's disease in a Chinese population, indicating its relevance in the pathogenesis of PD.
title: Bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis to identify key genes and pathways influencing in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The lead common variant (CV) at the 17q21.32 risk locus, rs882380, was identified as one of the top eQTLs for the HiChIP target genes SNX11 and HOXB2. This finding indicated a potential regulatory relationship between this SNP and the expression of these genes in the context of endometrial cancer.
title: Analysis of promoter-associated chromatin interactions reveals biologically relevant candidate target genes at endometrial cancer risk loci

finding: This SNP colocalized with a STAT5A eQTL and a nearby actQTL, indicating its role in influencing Treg function and potentially implicating pathways relevant to allergies through modulation of STAT5 mediated transcription.
title: Immune disease variants modulate gene expression in regulatory CD4+ T cells and inform drug targets

finding: This SNP mapped to an open chromatin region within the intron of STAT5B and was part of an LD block influencing Treg-related pathways, particularly relevant to allergy responses.
title: Immune disease variants modulate gene expression in regulatory CD4+ T cells and inform drug targets

finding: This SNP was part of the FDA5 PRS and was downstream of the gene SHISA6, which is associated with an insulin sensitivity measurement. It showed significant positive effects on weight-for-length/height ratios and higher values in children with rapid weight gain.
title: Polygenic risk score based on weight gain trajectories is predictive of childhood obesity

finding: rs12948076 near SOX9 and CASC17 was significantly linked to the angle of the nose and affected its prominence, where A alleles displayed a tendency for a higher nasal tip compared to G alleles, thus influencing nose morphology in terms of stereoscopic prominence.
title: Genome-wide Association study of facial morphology identifies novel genetic loci in Han Chinese

finding: The analysis found that the L_G allele (the minor L allele with a G substitution, corresponding to rs25531) exhibited lower promoter activity compared to the major L_A allele, while the S and L_G alleles had nearly equivalent promoter activity. This finding directly linked genetic variation at this locus to biological effects associated with the SLC6A4 gene, which is implicated in mood disorders.
title: Promoter activity-based case-control association study on SLC6A4 highlighting hypermethylation and altered amygdala volume in male patients with schizophrenia

finding: The SNP rs12947788, a heterozygous site within the 7th intron of the TP53 gene, was confirmed in the parental HCT116 cells. The direct sequencing showed C and T alleles in the mutated clones, indicating successful biallelic modification. The research demonstrated that the deletion of Alu elements in TP53 resulted in a significant increase in TP53 expression, impacting downstream genes involved in growth arrest and apoptosis.
title: Biallelic and gene-wide genomic substitution for endogenous intron and retroelement mutagenesis in human cells

finding: The SNP rs1641548, located in the ninth intron of TP53 in the human iPS cell line 201B7, was analyzed to confirm biallelic substitution following the UKiS method. Sequencing results indicated that the TP53 intron deletion was successful in both alleles of the targeted iPS clones, hence showing that this intron was dispensable for the retention of stemness in pluripotent cells.
title: Biallelic and gene-wide genomic substitution for endogenous intron and retroelement mutagenesis in human cells

finding: The missense variant rs17662853 in KANSL1 was linked to simple processing speed, highlighting its significance in cognitive processing pathways while having high linkage disequilibrium with other variants.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The predicted deleterious missense variant rs750623950 (p.Arg112Trp) in CD300LG was associated with a mean increase in HDL-C of 0.95 mmol/l, and also impacted HDL2-C and ApoA1 levels across the Finnish population.
title: Exome sequencing identifies high-impact trait-associated alleles enriched in Finns

finding: The SNP rs121918673 was located within the gene HNF1B on chromosome 17. It was reported to be associated with type 2 diabetes and was identified in a significant genomic region estimated to contribute to the shared genetic risk between type 2 diabetes and cataract.
title: The putative causal effect of type 2 diabetes in risk of cataract: a Mendelian randomization study in East Asian

finding: Similar to rs121918673, the SNP rs1555818071 was also identified within the HNF1B gene and was associated with type 2 diabetes. It was located within the same significant genomic region, reinforcing the genetic connection between type 2 diabetes-related variants and the risk for developing cataract.
title: The putative causal effect of type 2 diabetes in risk of cataract: a Mendelian randomization study in East Asian

finding: Mohtavinejad et al. in 2021 investigated the association between the CCL5 rs2107538 SNP and the risk of cardiovascular disease, establishing a significant relationship.
title: Comprehensive analysis of next-generation sequencing data in COVID-19 and its secondary complications

finding: The CCL2 rs3760396 variant was also linked to cardiovascular disease risk, as per the findings reported by Mohtavinejad et al. in 2021.
title: Comprehensive analysis of next-generation sequencing data in COVID-19 and its secondary complications

finding: The rs9913698 SNP, located in the 3' UTR of CD300LF, showed an AdaptMix P-value of 3.11×10^-9. It is significantly linked to monocyte and white blood cell counts, indicating its relevance in immune homeostasis within the Peruvian cohort.
title: Disentangling signatures of selection before and after European colonization in Latin Americans

finding: The SNP rs7217403 was identified as a significant novel lead SNP using the LOG-TRAM method on GWAS summary statistics related to Body Mass Index (BMI) from Biobank Japan (BBJ) and UK Biobank (UKBB). It exhibited a notable local heritability enrichment of 6.47 in East Asians (EAS) and 12.8 in Europeans (EUR). Both local and global co-heritability analyses suggested a strong local genetic architecture associated with rs7217403, emphasizing its role in BMI. This variant is located in an intergenic region near the gene MAP2K3, which has previously shown significant associations with BMI across diverse populations. The expression of MAP2K3 was positively correlated with BMI and activated during adipogenesis, further supporting the relevance of rs7217403 to obesity traits. The findings were replicated in the analysis of BBJ females and demonstrated consistent effect sizes with the replication datasets, reinforcing the potential of rs7217403 as a reproducible obesity locus.
title: Leveraging the local genetic structure for trans-ancestry association mapping

finding: The SNP rs792399 was found in an intron of the gene MSI2, and like the other SNPs in the Wnt subnetwork, it represented a significant interaction affecting lung function in SSc, uniquely highlighting the network's relevance to disease progression.
title: Genetic interactions affect lung function in patients with systemic sclerosis

finding: The CCL5 gene polymorphism rs2107538 was associated with type 2 diabetes mellitus in Saudi patients, suggesting its potential involvement in diabetic pathophysiology.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: CCL2 gene polymorphism rs3760396 was linked with the risk of cardiovascular disease, which may have implications for understanding cardiovascular comorbidities in renal conditions.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The alternative allele of rs847687 was associated with increased binding of the activating transcription factor EOMES and increased expression of the SGCA gene. This SNP was also identified as a disease risk locus linked to the vertical cup-disc ratio trait, suggesting a role of EOMES in the transcriptional regulation affecting this phenotype.
title: Quantitative assessment of association between noncoding variants and transcription factor binding

finding: The SNP rs2586434 was associated with the gene TCEA1, which is implicated in DNA binding. This association occurred within a trans-eQTL context.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs46522 represented a partially independent association signal for coronary artery disease, with an Odds Ratio of 1.03 (95% CI=1.02-1.05) observed in the context of genetic studies. The association with this SNP further confirmed its significance within the same genomic region previously linked to insomnia symptoms. The implications suggested that this SNP may contribute independently or in coordination with other signals within the region impacting cardiovascular health.
title: Identifying novel links between cardiovascular disease and insomnia by Drosophila modeling of genes from a pleiotropic GWAS locus

finding: The SNP rs869402 was located in the fourth haplotype block of the 17q12-21 locus and exhibited a statistically significant association with asthma (p = 5.35e-04). This finding was consistent even when analyzing only individuals with an age of onset less than 17 years old (p = 1.73e-04), highlighting its relevance to the phenotype.
title: GSDMA drives the most replicated association with asthma in naïve CD4+ T cells

finding: Similar to rs869402, the SNP rs9303281 was found in the fifth haplotype block and showed a significant association with asthma (p = 2.60e-04). This association also remained significant in the age-stratified analysis, reinforcing its contribution to the genetic basis of asthma.
title: GSDMA drives the most replicated association with asthma in naïve CD4+ T cells

finding: The SNP rs7216389 was observed to have evident eQTL interactions with ORMDL3 expression. The previous reports indicated its implications in methylation changes as well.
title: GSDMA drives the most replicated association with asthma in naïve CD4+ T cells

finding: The SNP rs2290400 was another variant that reflected significant eQTL interactions, contributing to understanding the genetic factors impacting asthma through alterations in gene expression.
title: GSDMA drives the most replicated association with asthma in naïve CD4+ T cells

finding: Analogous to the other SNPs, rs4795405 was associated with eQTL effects concerning the expression of ORMDL3, providing further insights into the genetic contributions to asthma.
title: GSDMA drives the most replicated association with asthma in naïve CD4+ T cells

finding: The SNP rs4065275 exhibited mQTL interactions with DNA methylation levels in the region surrounding ORMDL3, suggesting its role in regulating gene expression and disease pathology.
title: GSDMA drives the most replicated association with asthma in naïve CD4+ T cells

finding: Marker rs10560 was positioned on chromosome 4A, closely associated with previously identified QTLs effective against the PKTTS race. Its genetic position suggests it may contribute to leaf rust resistance during the seedling stage.
title: Identification of novel leaf rust seedling resistance loci in Iranian bread wheat germplasm using genome-wide association mapping

finding: The SNP rs74001624, which was associated with an exonic duplication involving the TEX19 gene, was found to significantly lower the expression levels of SECTM1. This association was important in relation to blood phenotypes, particularly affecting monocyte percentages, which is consistent with previously documented roles of SECTM1 in hematopoietic processes.
title: Resolving the insertion sites of polymorphic duplications reveals a HERC2 haplotype under selection

finding: The SNP rs149582052 was found to have an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) relationship with the gene PKCRA. This finding was derived from the analysis of iPSC-cardiomyocytes (iPSC-CMs) and was contextualized within the study's focus on gene expression variability related to gender and race.
title: A Resource of Gene Expression Data from a Multiethnic Population Cohort of Induced Pluripotent Cell–Derived Cardiomyocytes

finding: The rs62621401 variant in SPATA20 was identified as a rare variant associated specifically with decreased arm fat mass (β = -0.29, p = 1.5E-11), representing a large effect size within this fat depot, which was an original finding not previously associated with other anthropometric traits.
title: Regional fat depot masses are influenced by protein-coding gene variants

finding: SNP rs227727 was associated with higher activity in an allelic luciferase assay in both human fetal oral epithelial cells and murine osteoblastic cells. It acted as a causal SNP affecting creatinine levels, located in an intergenic region 92 kb from C17orf67, mimicking an enhancer chromatin state in muscle types.
title: Human and rat skeletal muscle single-nuclei multi-omic integrative analyses nominate causal cell types, regulatory elements, and SNPs for complex traits
