finding: The SNP rs4600514 was identified as a potentially damaging missense variant (p.R187W) in the TRIM47 gene at the 17q25 locus which was linked to increased risk of white matter hyperintensities (WMH). This variant's position was confirmed to be located in the RING-finger domain of TRIM47, crucial for its E3 ubiquitin ligase function, indicating that it may significantly affect the protein's functionality in neuronal processes.
title: White matter hyperintensity genetic risk factor TRIM47 regulates autophagy in brain endothelial cells

finding: This SNP demonstrated significance in the MAPT locus (p = 0.02), suggesting overlap with progressive supranuclear palsy (PSP) risk.
title: Genome-wide association study and functional validation implicates JADE1 in tauopathy

finding: The common T/C SNP rs2874164 was identified within the intronic DRB1 motif. This SNP was found to coexist with different alleles, specifically C in DRB1*01 and *04, and T in DRB1*03. It was previously established that SNPs affecting STAT1 binding motifs, such as those in the HLA-A gene, significantly influenced gene expression following IFNγ stimulation, indicating the relevant impact of this SNP in the context of immune response.
title: BCL6 regulates the endothelial pro-immunogenic phenotype relevant to organ transplant rejection

finding: The SNP rs111902263 was associated with individuals diagnosed with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD). Genetic analysis in a French cohort found a significant increase in the frequency of genotypes carrying the rare allele of this missense variant among autistic patients. This correlation indicated the critical role of the ubiquitin pathway in the etiology of autism, supporting its relevance as one of the candidate genes in ASD.
title: Autoencoder-transformed transcriptome improves genotype-phenotype association studies

finding: The rs5848 variant in the GRN gene was associated with an increased risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD). This association highlighted the importance of PGRN polymorphisms in neurodegenerative disorders. Furthermore, it was reported that this SNP reduced plasma and brain levels of granulin in Alzheimer's disease patients, indicating a potential mechanism by which PGRN deficiency could contribute to disease pathophysiology.
title: Progranulin inhibits phospholipase sPLA2-IIA to control neuroinflammation

finding: The SNP rs2526377 showed significant eQTLs in blood, correlating with the TRIM37 gene. The original study, however, indicated TSOAP1 as the most likely gene.
title: snpXplorer: a web application to explore human SNP-associations and annotate SNP-sets

finding: The SNP rs8070060 was associated with altered Wnt signaling pathways in cancer stem cell biology, which had implications for the behavior of Cancer Stem-Like Cells (CSLCs) in metastatic breast cancer, as discussed in a journal publication by de Sousa and Vermeulen in 2016.
title: Identification and Pharmacological Targeting of Treatment-Resistant, Stem-like Breast Cancer Cells for Combination Therapy

finding: The SREBF1 gene variant rs11868035 was associated with susceptibility to Parkinson's disease in a Chinese population, reinforcing its role in neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: This SNP was associated with sVCAM-1 levels and represented an eQTL for ABCA8 across several tissues, suggesting its role in regulating sVCAM-1 concentration through mechanisms linked to lipid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies seven novel loci associating with circulating cytokines and cell adhesion molecules in Finns

finding: The SNP rs5848 was identified as being associated with reduced levels of progranulin (PGRN) in both plasma and brain of neurodegenerative disease patients, suggesting that polymorphism at this locus may contribute to the pathobiology of diseases like Alzheimer's disease and frontotemporal dementia (FTD) by affecting PGRN levels, which are critical for neuronal health and proteostasis.
title: Frontotemporal Dementia Patient Neurons With Progranulin Deficiency Display Protein Dyshomeostasis

finding: This SNP was identified upstream of the RHOT1 gene and was part of the greenlisted variants enriched in regions near known regulators of L1 expression, suggesting a role in L1 and Alu regulation.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS reveals loci linked to human variation in LINE-1- and Alu-copy numbers

finding: The S209F variant of ABI3 (rs616338:p.Ser209Phe) was associated with an increased risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD), showing an odds ratio of 1.43 and a p-value of 4.5×10^-10. This finding indicates that the variant is a significant risk factor for AD, with a minor allele frequency of 0.008. Additionally, this association was confirmed in a secondary study, reinforcing its relevance in AD pathogenesis.
title: Deletion of Abi3/Gngt2 influences age-progressive amyloid β and tau pathologies in distinctive ways

finding: The rs1024611 polymorphism was associated with increased plasma CCL2 expression, and specifically the G allele was linked to increased serum levels of CCL2, macrophage recruitment, and progression to diseases such as HIV-associated dementia, myocardial infarction, and lupus nephritis.
title: Functional characterization of the disease-associated CCL2 rs1024611G-rs13900T haplotype: The role of the RNA-binding protein HuR

finding: The rs13900 polymorphism exhibited allelic expression imbalance, with the T allele showing higher expression than the C allele. It was reported to confer greater stability to CCL2 mRNA and to facilitate increased binding to the RNA-binding protein HuR, thereby enhancing CCL2 expression and playing a role in disease susceptibility.
title: Functional characterization of the disease-associated CCL2 rs1024611G-rs13900T haplotype: The role of the RNA-binding protein HuR

finding: The rs1042522 variant in TP53 was associated with myocardial infarction, emphasizing the gene's involvement in the disease pathology.
title: Identification and Interaction Analysis of Molecular Markers in Myocardial Infarction by Integrated Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: Similar to rs1042522, rs8064946 variant in TP53 showed an association with myocardial infarction, further supporting the role of TP53 variants in MI.
title: Identification and Interaction Analysis of Molecular Markers in Myocardial Infarction by Integrated Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The finding regarding rs7221217 indicated that it contributed to increased chromatin accessibility at the promoter/TSS of RNF135 in individuals of African ancestry compared to those of European ancestry. Despite the presence of mismatches to the reference genome, this SNP was associated with significant epigenomic changes relevant to ALS.
title: Disease related changes in ATAC-Seq of more than 450 iPSC-derived motor neuron lines from ALS patients and controls

finding: Similar to rs7221217, rs7221238 was found to be linked to higher accessibility of the RNF135 promoter region in individuals of African ancestry. This SNP aligns with the epigenomic profiles that were explored in relation to ALS.
title: Disease related changes in ATAC-Seq of more than 450 iPSC-derived motor neuron lines from ALS patients and controls

finding: Analysis of rs7219775 showed that it was associated with increased accessibility of the RNF135 promoter in African ancestry individuals, which underscores the epigenomic alterations that may hold implications for understanding ALS.
title: Disease related changes in ATAC-Seq of more than 450 iPSC-derived motor neuron lines from ALS patients and controls

finding: The SNP rs7221473 exhibited similar patterns of accessibility at the RNF135 promoter/TSS in subjects of African ancestry, contributing to the overall insights into genetic influences on chromatin state linked to ALS.
title: Disease related changes in ATAC-Seq of more than 450 iPSC-derived motor neuron lines from ALS patients and controls

finding: Findings for rs7225888 revealed its influence on chromatin accessibility at the RNF135 region, confirming the intersection of ancestry and epigenomic profiles that could be relevant to ALS pathology.
title: Disease related changes in ATAC-Seq of more than 450 iPSC-derived motor neuron lines from ALS patients and controls

finding: For rs7211440, the data illustrated that it was significantly associated with chromatin accessibility changes at the RNF135 promoter in genetically diverse backgrounds, emphasizing the relevance of ancestry in ALS research.
title: Disease related changes in ATAC-Seq of more than 450 iPSC-derived motor neuron lines from ALS patients and controls

finding: While it does not have known disease associations, it was identified in strong linkage disequilibrium with Th1/Th2-associated SNPs and impacts the expression of genes in the context of vitamin D influence.
title: Vitamin D constrains inflammation by modulating the expression of key genes on Chr17q12-21.1

finding: rs145053802, located in the PER1 gene, demonstrated a significant association with suicide death and had a CADD PHRED score greater than 22, indicating its potential role as a deleterious variant.
title: Rare protein coding variants implicate genes involved in risk of suicide death

finding: The second signal rs10962 at the HNF1B locus was assigned to liver with a probable causal variant (PPA=0.98) located in a transcribed region specific to liver.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: The signal rs2189301 at the HNF1B locus was classified as 'shared' with the principal credible set variants mapped to both islet and liver.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs55974014 was associated with left-handedness and located in the 17q21.31 locus, which has known connections to various neurological traits, including mood swings and educational attainment traits.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 48 common genetic variants associated with handedness

finding: The SNP rs4795399 at the 17q12 locus was also significantly associated with earlier age of asthma onset. Each copy of the risk allele was associated with an average of 2.29 years earlier onset compared to individuals without the risk allele, with a p-value of 6.76×10^-65. This finding contributes to understanding the genetic risk factors influencing the age of asthma onset.
title: Shared and Distinct Genetic Risk Factors for Childhood Onset and Adult Onset Asthma: Genome- and Transcriptome-wide Studies

finding: The MTMR4*V297G variant was linked to cognitive function, which has implications for the cognitive decline seen in Alzheimer's patients.
title: In vivo validation of late-onset Alzheimer’s disease genetic risk factors

finding: The SNP rs1024611, associated with the CCL2 gene, was identified as a significant genetic polymorphism relevant to Philadelphia-Negative Myeloproliferative Neoplasms according to the study by Hodeib et al. (2022). This polymorphism was implicated in the modulation of CCL2 expression, which plays a critical role in immune response during neuroinflammation and has connections to neurodegenerative diseases such as Alzheimer's and Parkinson's.
title: CCL2 and Neuronal Inflammation: Implications for Neurodegenerative Diseases

finding: The SNP rs769427 (c.853C>T, p.Pro285Ser) in OR1A1 likely altered the capacity to detect citronellic terpenoid substances. This mutation affected a conserved proline residue critical for the transition to active forms of GPCRs.
title: The mutational landscape of human olfactory G protein-coupled receptors

finding: The rs2297518 variant in the NOS2 gene, which results in increased NO production, was positively associated with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), specifically both Crohn's disease (CD) and ulcerative colitis (UC). This association was highlighted due to the significant upregulation of NOS2 within LND cells, a novel cell type implicated in the pathogenesis of CD.
title: A Specialized Epithelial Cell Type Regulating Mucosal Immunity and Driving Human Crohn’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs7214041 was associated with pancreatic cancer risk and was part of the broader investigation into pancreatic cancer susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel GP2 gene risk variants for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs7224610 in the HLF locus was linked to serum urate levels, possessing enhancer signatures and implicating it in regulatory mechanisms.
title: Genomic dissection of 43 serum urate-associated loci provides multiple insights into molecular mechanisms of urate control
